title: Stochastic PDEs for large portfolios with general mean-reverting volatility processes
abstract: arXiv:1906.05898v4 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: We consider a structural stochastic volatility model for the loss from a large portfolio of credit risky assets. Both the asset value and the volatility processes are correlated through systemic Brownian motions, with default determined by the asset value reaching a lower boundary. We prove that if our volatility models are picked from a class of mean-reverting diffusions, the system converges as the portfolio becomes large and, when the vol-of-vol function satisfies certain regularity and boundedness conditions, the limit of the empirical measure process has a density given in terms of a solution to a stochastic initial-boundary value problem on a half-space. The problem is defined in a special weighted Sobolev space. Regularity results are established for solutions to this problem, and then we show that there exists a unique solution. tldr: 该研究提出了一个结构性随机波动率模型，用于大型信用风险资产组合的损失建模，并证明了在投资组合规模变大时系统会收敛，同时提出了一种密度方程，描述了经验测度过程的极限情况，并且解决方案在特殊加权Sobolev空间中定义。
en_tdlr: This study presents a structural stochastic volatility model for modeling the loss of a large portfolio of credit risky assets, and proves the convergence of the system as the portfolio size increases, while introducing a density equation describing the limit of the empirical measure process, with the solution defined in a special weighted Sobolev space.
